page.title: 08Landscape (contd.)
page.content: this survey has revealed only small remnants of the once extensive Haywood, which covered the area in the original Domesday period. A final comment must be made about the high incidence of orchard crops within the area. Most farms have a small proportion of land allocated to this category. Orchard cropping is a traditional practice in this area supplying the nearby cider factory each Autumn with many old varieties of apples. However, many orchards are now under threat due to cutbacks in demand and increased competition from abroad.
